description: Women under 60 can benefit from hormone therapy to treat hot flashes and other symptoms of menopause. That's according to a new study, and is a departure from what women were told in the past.
title: Hormones for menopause are safe, study finds. Here's what changed

description:
From New York — to Illinois — to Los Angeles — encampments in support of Palestinians dot campuses across the country.

And over the last couple of days the tension has only increased as police have intervened on several campuses, including Columbia University, UCLA and the University of Texas. Hundreds of protestors have been arrested.

Pro-Palestinian protests on college campuses are growing in scope and intensity, and colleges are calling on law enforcement to help. Is it the right decision, and what happens next?

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
title: For weeks students have protested the war in Gaza — now things are escalating

description: He was a pioneering guitar hero whose reverberating electric sound on instrumentals such as "Rebel Rouser" and "Peter Gunn" influenced George Harrison, Bruce Springsteen and countless other musicians.
title: Duane Eddy, who put the twang in early rock guitar with 'Rebel Rouser', dies at age 86

description: President Gustavo Petro announced his country will break diplomatic ties with Israel Thursday over its actions in Gaza. "If Palestine dies, humanity dies, and we are not going to let it die," he said.
title: Colombia will break relations with Israel over its actions in Gaza, Petro says

description: The New York State Court of Appeals overturned Weinstein's 2020 conviction last week, ruling that his trial was unfair.
title: Harvey Weinstein's New York trial, round two, is likely to move forward in the fall

description: European countries that border Russia are concerned that they'll be invaded next if an emboldened Russia is successful in Ukraine, even though they're members of the NATO alliance. We go to the Baltic nation of Estonia and hear from people who are making preparations in case of invasion.
title: Invasion Worries in Eastern Europe

description: The Federal Reserve held interest rates steady Wednesday, as inflation remained stubbornly above the Fed's 2% target. Investors now think it could be September or later before rates start to fall.
title: Fed keeps interest rates at 23-year high

description: President Biden announced the relief for attendees of the now-shuttered art schools, saying they "falsified data, knowingly misled students, and cheated borrowers into taking on mountains of debt."
title: Biden forgives more than $6 billion in loans for 317,000 Art Institutes students

description: Members of pro-Palestinian and pro-Israel groups in Los Angeles sometimes tussled, with reports that protesters used fireworks and pepper spray. It was hours before police restored calm.
title: Violence erupts at UCLA as protests over Israel's war in Gaza escalate across the U.S.

description: Ford is recalling nearly 243,000 Maverick small pickup trucks in the U.S. because the tail lights may not illuminate. The recall covers certain pickups from the 2022 through 2024 model years.
title: Ford recalls Maverick pickups because tail lights can go dark, increasing crash risk

description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, R-Ga., says she will follow through on her threat to hold a vote to oust Speaker Mike Johnson sometime next week, despite signs that her effort will fail.
title: Majorie Taylor Greene is planning a vote next week to oust Speaker Johnson

description: The time a person has to decide whether to have an abortion in Florida and other states with six-week abortion bans is at most two weeks. Why? It's has to do with how we date early pregnancy.
title: Why is a 6-week abortion ban nearly a total ban? It's about how we date a pregnancy

description: Sure, new parents are an anxious lot. But instruction manuals for devices meant to keep the baby safe and healthy are daunting and add to the anxiety. Why are they so confusing?
title: Oh dear! Baby gear! Why are the manuals so unclear?

description: People in Florida no longer have access to abortion after six weeks of pregnancy. Police have cleared Hamilton Hall and the pro-Palestinian encampment at Columbia University.
title: Florida abortion ban takes effect; NYPD breaks up Columbia protests

description: People who've lived in co-ops, communes, group houses and 'intentional communities' share four questions you should ask yourself before taking the leap.
title: What is 'communal living' and is it right for me?

description: The protests sweeping college campuses don't just involve students. Professors are increasingly pushing back against university administrations they see as infringing on students' free speech rights.
title: How some faculty members are defending student protesters, in actions and in words

description: The state is shaping up to be big battleground over abortion rights in November. Research shows a majority of U.S. Catholics supports abortion rights — even though church leadership does not.
title: For many Missouri Catholics, abortion rights means choosing between faith, politics

description: After former President Donald Trump and Arizona GOP senate candidate Kari Lake distanced themselves from the law, some abortion rights opponents are left wondering who they can count on.
title: Christian conservatives wrestle with shifting GOP stance on Arizona abortion ban

description: A new 2024 election poll from NPR/PBS NewsHour/Marist shows fundamental divides over concerns for America's future and what to teach the next generation.
title: NPR poll: Democrats fear fascism, and Republicans worry about a lack of values

description: Three police officers and two paramedics faced felony charges in death of McClain, a young Black man not suspected of a crime. Two cops were aquitted.
title: Reforms and heartbreak after final sentencing in Elijah McClain's death

description: In his 43 years at the L.A. Times, Louis Sahagún reported on everything from the Latino communities of east LA, to the plight of the desert tortoise. And he got his start sweeping floors.
title: After chronicling California at 'L.A. Times' for 43 years, Louis Sahagún has retired

description: Nickelodeon's megahit show SpongeBob SquarePants made its TV debut on May 1, 1999. Fans of the cartoon span generations and the animated series has become a multibillion-dollar franchise.
title: Before living in a pineapple under the sea, SpongeBob was born as an educational tool

description: A drought has upended life in several South American cities, leading to water rationing and power cuts as well as forest fires.
title: El Niño weather is leading to droughts and power cuts in South America

description: There's growing support from Republicans in Congress for excluding non-U.S. citizens from a special census count that the 14th Amendment says must include the "whole number of persons in each state."
title: Republicans in Congress are trying to reshape election maps by excluding noncitizens

description: Some birds kill their siblings soon after hatching. Other birds spend their whole lives with their siblings and will even risk their lives to help each other.
title: For birds, siblinghood can be a matter of life or death

description: A surprise announcement that revealed Haiti's new prime minister is threatening to fracture a recently installed transitional council tasked with choosing new leaders for the gang-riddled country.
title: The announcement of a new prime minister divides Haiti's transitional council

description: The Arkansas-based company said that after managing the clinics it launched in 2019 and expanding its telehealth program, it concluded "there is not a sustainable business model for us to continue."
title: Walmart says it will close its 51 health centers and virtual care service

description: A leading figure in his generation of postmodern American writers, Auster wrote more than 20 novels, including City of Glass, Sunset Park, 4 3 2 1 and The Brooklyn Follies.
title: Bestselling novelist Paul Auster, author of The New York Trilogy, dies at 77

description: The National Trust's annual list includes Eatonville, the all-Black Florida town memorialized by Zora Neale Hurston, Alaska's Sitka Tlingit Clan houses, and the home of country singer Cindy Walker.
title: Here's this year's list of the most endangered historic places in the U.S.
